gameDescription: Two state-of-the-art airships, lent by the philanthropic organisations, Greater Good Charities and Wildlife At Risk, embark on a critical mission to rescue pangolins from rampant poaching in Africa, and transport them to a newly constructed sanctuary in Vietnam. They must navigate strategically through difficult conditions and threats to ensure the safety and well-being of this nearly extinct species. Every decision carries a massive impact not only on the success of their mission but also on biodiversity preservation.

setting.location: Above Africa and en-route to Vietnam

blueTeam.name: Aegis Airlift
blueTeam.description: Pioneers in wildlife rescue and relocation, showcasing unmatched adaptability and crisis management.

redTeam.name: Guardian Galleons
redTeam.description: Heralded for their stealth capabilities and intrusion prevention expertise in wildlife conservation efforts.

turns.scenario: The airlift operations are under way, but the teams receive intelligence that poachers are converging to their location. They must decide on an immediate action plan.

options.A: Enhance defences and continue with the operation, risking potential confrontation.
options.B: Pause the operation, camouflage the airships and wait for poachers to leave.

AA.narrative: Both teams decide to fortify and continue. There's tension in the air. With advanced stealth technology and safety measures, they manage to avoid detection without slowing down the mission.

AB.narrative: One team fortifies while the other camouflages. These simultaneous actions confuse the poachers, buying the team that paused more time to safely resume operations.

BA.narrative: One team camouflages while the other fortifies. The persistent team extracts more pangolins but also attracts attention, leading to a heated pursuit that costs them fuel and time.

BB.narrative: Both teams pause operations and camouflage. The airships blend seamlessly into the sky, and the poachers leave without noticing them, preserving the safety of the pangolins.

turns.scenario: Mid-flight, the airships face severe sandstorms that could impact their navigational systems and energy reserves.

options.A: Activate advanced weather resistant shields and hold the course.
options.B: Take a detour to avoid the worst part of the storm, which can result in more travel time.

AA.narrative: Both teams activate shields and proceed. The airships battle against the roaring winds, but the shield technology holds, preserving their precious cargo at the cost of energy reserves.

AB.narrative: One airship activates shields while the other detours. The detouring ship takes more time but conserves energy, while the shielded ship plows ahead much faster but at a higher energy cost.

BA.narrative: One team detours while the other holds the course. The team holding the course reaches the destination faster but at a substantial hydrogen cost, while the detouring team conserves energy but is delayed.

BB.narrative: Both teams decide to detour. The detour adds to their travel time but with a significant advantage of minimal energy consumption, contributing to the mission's sustainability objective.

turns.scenario: As they approach Vietnam, the airships receive news of a sudden increase in air traffic due to an international air-show. To ensure safe arrival, choices have to be made.

options.A: Contact the authorities for a safe passage, running the risk of attracting attention back home.
options.B: Land at a remote location and transport the pangolins to the enclosure via ground transport, which could stress the pangolins and delay their recovery.

AA.narrative: Both teams take the bold step to contact the authorities. Recognising their noble mission, the authorities clear a path and even provide an escort! The pangolins are safely delivered to the sanctuary.

AB.narrative: One team contacts the authorities and the other lands remotely. The air-show attendees are moved by the rescue mission and pledge support, while the ground team successfully transports the animals with minimum delay.

BA.narrative: One team lands remotely, resulting in a delayed but safe final leg of the journey, whilst the other team secures a safe passage causing a ripple effect of global support for pangolin protection.

BB.narrative: Both teams decide to land at a remote location. The pangolins, though stressed, are safely transported to the enclosure, thus concluding a successful, albeit challenging, rescue mission.
